conclusion: The x-axis represents time (t) in seconds (s) and the y-axis represents position (x) in meters (m).
The graph depicts a straight line. The equation of a straight line in a position-time graph is x(t) = v * t + x_0.
At t = 0, the line passes through x = 10 meters.
The line passes through the point (0, 10).
As time increases by 2 seconds from t = 0 to t = 2, the position changes from x = 10 to x = 20.
The velocity v is calculated as v = (20 m - 10 m) / (2 s - 0 s) = 5 m/s.
Since the car is moving at a constant velocity, the speed at any point in time is 5 m/s.
The car's speed at the end of the 2nd second is 5 m/s.
